text: Hello all! How to check amount of sessions in each month for a blog? I need to prepare 2023 report but it seems like blog analitycs tool is showing totally different values than custom report builder. Is there a property or filter such as "unique sessions" in custom report builder? :thinking:

Has anyone run into this issue ? I'm trying to pull a featured image from a CRM Record (see screenshot). When I pull it onto the CMS membership page and PPrint it -- this is what I get (second screenshot).

Why isn't there a way to just get to the file path?? I'm getting a bunch of metadata that isn't super valuable --

cc <@U7SL518D6>, <@U2H3TT8F2> and <@UQWGKUEN7> -- any insights here guys?

Hi, just wondering if anyone has got a solution for creating a report on goals and using a dataset for a deal, as line item information is only accessible reporting-wise through a dataset and i require this to build the report?

Also i've noticed filtering on this fiscal year it is not loading correctly and setting the value to 0 instead of the actual value. The goal for this is set to monthly and the fiscal year settings is April - March
I'm having the same issue here
friendlyUrl also doesn't seem to give anything valuable
right -- HubSpot please help!
<@U38EZFVFE> you solved this by just using a form to upload these files right?
No. I changed the firld to a multiline text firld and manual upload for noew.
my client wants to use the file upload --
We might be creating an upload tool that will allow us to contrioll where the images go and how they get added to the CRM object
lol that sucks, seems like a form might be the better way around this.
you can not use the file upload
a object selector and custom fil eupload
*if you want to use the images on the CMS
using api
<@U38EZFVFE> what might be cooler is just a proxy that will setup the signed_urls
it would obviously have to check that the file is publicly visible and if so just send the signed_url back to the user
less complexity is better
yeah you're not wrong, this way would allow you to use the HubSpot uploads and the field visibility options like they were designed

Hello everyone! New to the slack.
Does anyone know if there is any information/docs on hooking hubpsot up to to gitlab using git instead of using github?
Hopefully this is the area to ask?

Hey <@U05PZV1JACQ> - we only allow promotion in the <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> or <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channels, as per our community <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct#unwanted-solicitation-of-services|Code of Conduct>. I'm going to delete this from here, but I think it's good fit for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase>. Thanks!

Currently, I am uploading files, creating a note, and attaching files to the note.

Do you know if I am able to populate a file_property on a deal record via API?

cc: <@U037ZPYEGAF>
You can send the file id from file manager directly to the file property
yep yep
Thanks! much appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
